intro: Arctotis aenea, commonly known as the silverleaf fleur-de-lis, is a perennial flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is drought-tolerant and often used in rock gardens or as a border plant due to its ornamental value. Arctotis aenea is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
